projects.title: Open ECHO - European Unconventional Hydrocarbon Portal
projects.description: The European Unconventional Hydrocarbon Portal (Open ECHO) is an information portal developed by the European Commission using publically available evidences. The portal aims to provide an informed overview on unconventional hydrocarbons activities in Europe. The main stakeholders of the portal are energy experts and policy makers but not limited as the portal will be publically available from launching. Hence, in addition, citizens, researchers, academic, industry are targeted. This leads to portal ambivalence, whereas it has to serve users without previous knowledge about unconventional hydrocarbons along with users that holds the expertise and wants to retrieve or put in certain context (economical, technical, and geological) the information presented within the portal.

contributors.headline: Project Manager & Innovation Lead at Groundstation.Space // Technology & Innovation Advisor at Spectrum Intelligence

projects.title: EUOGA -  European Unconventional Oil and Gas Assessment
projects.description: European Unconventional oil and gas assessment (EUOGA) is an inventory of existing published knowledge on shale oil and gas resources in Europe. The project (based on H2020 call, “Energy Policy support on unconventional gas and oil” from the European Commission, by GEUS regarding a “Geological Evaluation of Potential Unconventional Oil and Gas Resources in Europe”) will compile data from European countries which are members of EuroGeoSurveys (EGS) and the European Union (including Switzerland and Ukraine). The project will define a common resource assessment methodology and make results available in a Geographical Information System (GIS) database and on a website

profile_positions.description:
Management of proposals and projects within research framework programmes from Dutch space sector, Horizon Europe, ESA or other international organisations.

Making space data manageable and comprehensible for end-users and maximising the value of unique Earth Observation data is what drives dotSPACE. ‘The Groundstation’ is a space data expert centre, and a landmark for space data use on the NL Space Campus in Noordwijk in which knowledge transfer from space to non-space environments, financing and tender support of innovation projects with space data and user engagement via our online platform are key activities.
profile_positions.title: EU Project Manager & Innovation Lead

profile_positions.description:
Head of Innovation and Management responsible for activating new technologies and the overall management of the company projects portfolio. Also, Member of Advisory Board responsible for Technology, Innovation and Social Impact track.  

Spectrum Intelligence serves the inclusive society and the inclusive economy by having social and technology impact. The activity field of Spectrum Intelligence is Data Annotation. The Spectrum Intelligence employees, from the Autistic Spectrum, are using their specific advanced skills of precision, patience, attention to details and repetitiveness in order to provide the best quality, accurate secure data and the best cost/efficiency value to the data annotation market requirements.
profile_positions.title: Head of Innovation and Management

profile_positions.description:
R&D for Public Research and Workshops
Our mission is to facilitate disruptive technologies uptake by participating in public research projects or organise workshops which concentrate on critical and generative engagement with data (e.g. Earth Observation, AI, GIS, IoT, Sensors) and digital tools.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
Science, Technology & Engineering
Innovation spin-off inspired by making impact with digital technology. Our mission is to challenge the status quo by delivering out-of-the-box solutions that transforms our clients digital ecosystems and businesses.

https://www.theloop.systems/
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
Project management for the Geological Survey of the Netherlands/Geomodelling Department responsible for the development and update of the four subsurface models of the Netherlands (GeoTOP, REGIS, DGM and NL3D), e.g. Project Coordination Team for GeoERA project (geoera.eu), Project Lead for Think or Sink project (Artificial Intelligence for Subsidence Assessment and Prediction).
Business development and grant advisor forming research consortia and writing proposals for Horizon 2020, ESA or European Partnership calls.
profile_positions.title: International Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Senior Technical Consultant for Space4Good responsible for delivering to its clients custom solutions using  innovative and leading edge space industry and geospatial information technologies. My main task at Space4Good was to initiate and lead innovative R&D activities. 
I lead the implementation of several Earth Observation case studies into customer applications contributing to new business models. I lead the operational and strategic execution of several proof of concepts and prototypes. 
One of the biggest achievement is the successful closing of a three-year contract to protect  a large tropical forest area in Borneo (Indonesia) using a technological solution. I lead the team which submitted the Reforester Platform concept, a comprehensive tool for (agro-/)forest management, monitoring, risk assessment and conservation.
Another achievement is the successful launching of the Mothership Coder Missions open innovation program created by Space4Good, World Startup Factory and Ai Lab One. I drew up the partnership agreement with European Commission for organising the Energy Poverty challenge (CODER MISSION #1) as part of the Hackathon for Peace Justice & Security in The Hague (June, 2019).
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor

company.name: Joint Research Centre (JRC) - European Commission's Science Service

profile_positions.description:
I worked as part of Energy Security, Systems and Markets Unit of the JRC’s Directorate C for Energy, Climate and Transport. I fulfilled my job having multiple roles, such as Researcher, Project/Product Developer or Program/Business Manager. I focused on projects in the area of geological resources assessment and the analysis of energy markets. I covered a broad portfolio of energy policies from the assessment of technologies and environmental impact of  (un-)conventional hydrocarbons, geothermal, coal, to the establishment of European industrial platforms (e.g. unconventional hydrocarbons, coal regions in transition).

I was Project Lead for several tasks of a multinational European geo-energy project (EUOGA) funded by the Commission under Horizon2020. The project was performed in collaboration with the Geological Survey of Europe (EGS). I  provided support to the launching of the Coal Regions in Transition Platform by contributing to the first report on the "Socio-economic transformation in coal transition regions: analysis and proposed approach (Pilot case in Upper Nitra, Slovakia)" or being part of the EU delegation which formally met with the Romanian government, members of parliament and local authorities in Bucharest (2017) under the auspices of the same platform.

I was Software Architect leading the development of several JRC knowledge management applications contributing to the general Commission's knowledge sharing and digital transformation strategies.  I formed a team of programmers, energy experts and analysts which developed within several years a series of pan-European interactive online tools and knowledge sharing portals, e.g.: the Unconventional Hydrocarbons Atlas of Resource Assessment, the Unconventional Hydrocarbons Database of Wells, and the European Unconventional Hydrocarbon Portal (https://openecho.jrc.ec.europa.eu).
profile_positions.title: Researcher&Policy Officer at European Commission

company.name: Joint Research Centre (JRC) - European Commission's Science Service

profile_positions.description:
I worked as part of the Energy Technology Policy Outlook (ETPO) Unit which supports the development, implementation and monitoring of EU Energy Technology Policy through techno-socio-economic assessments and modelling.
• Project manager for CCUS Project. Specific tasks: technology assessment and evaluation, project management, policy analysis and making.
• Responsibilities: providing science based policy support to European Commission. Specific tasks: performing internal scientific studies, writing reports and briefs, writing terms of specifications for external tender studies, project management, workshop organization.
• Accomplishments: project management (scientific supervision for EC) of three ongoing and finished external tender studies worth of 440K EUR; wrote three terms of specifications for tenders studies and software support with an award quotation of 160K EUR; wrote 11 EC internal publications from which five were reports and one Chapter from the SET PLAN Technology Map (Geothermal Technology).

My role was to perform:
- in-depth analyses of the potential and full implications of RD&D investments on the performance and deployment of New Energy Technology options and their impact on the European Energy and Climate Policy Goals 
- assess low carbon technological pathways with respect to their technical performance and cost-effectiveness, their potential contribution to CO2 emission reduction and analyse issues and developments related to spatial planning and infrastructure
These activities feed in the Technology and Capacities Maps of SETIS (SET Plan) decision making and supports the European Commission's initiatives regarding low carbon energy technologies.

Energy Portfolio:
Carbon Capture & Storage (CCS)
Carbon Capture & Utilization (CCU)
European CO2 Geological Storage Atlas
Technology Map of the European SET Plan
CO2 Storage Permits Review
Underground Gas Storage
Shale Gas
Geothermal
profile_positions.title: Scientific Officer at European Commission

profile_positions.description:
• Course teaching of Earth Sciences and GIS applied in Geophysics
• Responsibilities: Teaching courses or conducting field work applications for university level students. I laid foundation of the geophysics modelling computing cluster by porting open source or commercial geophysical software to Linux environment which lead to an exponential increase of student or research publications and conference participations.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description:
• Researcher Applied Geophysics and Environmental Engineering
• Responsibilities: conducting research within various EU and Romanian grants in the area of Applied Geophysics and Environmental Engineering. Specific tasks: I conducted multiple field experiments and data acquisition using geophysical instruments(geoelectrical, magnetometry, gravimetry, active and passive seismics, differential GPS) or processed, modelled and interpreted geo-data (2D&3D geological and geophysical modelling, tomography, ray-tracing, inversion, GIS and geospatial numerical modelling, neural networks). I was responsible for the procurement, maintenance and technical supervision for the department's geophysical instruments (geode/seismic stations and geophones, seismic controlled source, ohmapper, magnetometers and gradiometers, rezistivitymeters, etc.)
profile_positions.title: Assistant Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Laboratory teaching Earth Physics/Geodynamics 
• Responsibilities: teaching to undergraduate students the laboratory applications for Earth Sciences. Specific tasks: helping students towards obtaining their annual quota of credits by conducting field work experiments (data acquisition) using geophysical instruments and methods to map and interpret geophysical anomalies.
profile_positions.title: Laboratory Assistant & Assistant Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Junior Geophysicist
• Responsibilities: geological and geophysical data modelling and interpretation. Specific tasks: magnetic, geoelectric and electromagnetic data modelling and interpretation for mineral exploration and mining consulting; mapping (GIS and AutoCAD) and reports writing.
profile_positions.title: Geophysicist
